intro: Melodinus cochinchinensis, commonly known as the Vietnamese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
